title: Student Assistant Interview
Application Type: I interviewed at Texas Tech University
Interview Descriptions: Smooth, nothing crazy. I wouldn’t consider it an interview, it was more like a conversation. Everyone was kind and relaxed and was knowledgeable about the role and process andwhat experience I would gain
Interview Questions: Tell me about yourself and your interests

title: Programmer Analyst III Interview
Application Type: I applied online. I interviewed at Texas Tech University (Lubbock, TX) in Apr 2023
Interview Descriptions: The interview process usually has one interview where they ask about your experience and it’s basically just behavioral. The process is very long even of it’s just one interview, be prepared to wait for a month or more.
Interview Questions: What difficulties have you faced in your work an how did you overcome it?

title: Assistant Professor of Practice Interview
Application Type: I applied through college or university. I interviewed at Texas Tech University (Lubbock, TX) in Mar 2023
Interview Descriptions: Pretty straight forward interview. Initial screening call was about 30 minutes. Less than a week I was asked to schedule a 1 hour-30 min lecture demo and 30 minute department meeting.
Interview Questions: Basic questions about teaching philosophy, previous experiences, why lubbock, how will you manage big classrooms. Mostly about teaching

title: Academic Advisor Interview
Application Type: I interviewed at Texas Tech University
Interview Descriptions: Panel interviewing 30mins with tour It wasn’t too difficult just be genuine truly easy going. Make eye contact with everyone not just the person asking questions. Stay engaged and prepare to have your own questions. It is also important to know details about the college applying to.
Interview Questions: How would you present someone with bad news?

title: Research Assistant Interview
Application Type: I interviewed at Texas Tech University
Interview Descriptions: Describe what you know and what you did in the previous research work. Be confident and patience to explain everything in detail. Tour around the compass and introduce themselves. Friendly and nice.
Interview Questions: Behavior question Principle question Coding question

title: Facilities Lead Interview
Application Type: I interviewed at Texas Tech University
Interview Descriptions: It was a short process that took a little over two weeks when it was all said and done. Great people to work with and interact with on a day to day level.
Interview Questions: Why would you be a good fit

title: Grad Assistant Interview
Application Type: I interviewed at Texas Tech University
Interview Descriptions: Liars. They don’t tell you the exact details of the job and you work 90 hours a week. Do not go here at all. Seriously. Not worth the mental health decline.
Interview Questions: Where are you from originally

title: Facility Manager Interview
Application Type: I applied through college or university. The process took 3 days. I interviewed at Texas Tech University (Lubbock, TX) in Jul 2022
Interview Descriptions: Very simple. It's a 15 minutes in-person interview with most current supervisors in the facility depending on which department you are applying for. They each get to ask you a question.
Interview Questions: How do you handle conflict?

title: Marketing Project Manager Interview
Application Type: I applied online. The process took 1+ week. I interviewed at Texas Tech University (Lubbock, TX) in Jul 2022
Interview Descriptions: After sharing my resume and portfolio I was invited in for an interview the following week. I was brought into a conference room with 10 faculty and staff members who asked industry and creative process related questions.
Interview Questions: I received various questions about how I would handle different scenarios regarding creative and strategic processes, managing others, and the basic questions about positive and negative experience in my previous roles.  I was also asked about my skillset/confidence in various creative tools and platforms, ex: video editing, graphic design, email.

title: Sales Executive Interview
Application Type: I interviewed at Texas Tech University
Interview Descriptions: Very friendly and was a quick process! There was about 3 people sitting in on the interview. Everyone was friendly but stern. Called me back within a week, they were very good with communicating to me during the interview process as well.
Interview Questions: Describe a time you needed to create a solution to a problem

title: Veterinary Technician Interview
Application Type: I applied in-person. The process took 3 months. I interviewed at Texas Tech University in May 2022
Interview Descriptions: I filled out an application online through the recommended website. I submitted the requested reference letters and CV. I was later called for an in person interview. The interview was a panel of faculty/staff.
Interview Questions: Do you have any questions for us?

title: Reseach Assistant Interview
Application Type: I interviewed at Texas Tech University
Interview Descriptions: Ask about basic knowledge in Electrical Engineering such as circuit analysis, fundamental electronic, and basic of the transistor. The interviewers select a diagram with MOSFET, and ask the candidates to bias a voltage/current value for a certain node.
Interview Questions: What is the voltage waveform at the output?

title: IT Support Specialist I Interview
Application Type: I interviewed at Texas Tech University
Interview Descriptions: The interview consisted of one 40 minute Zoom conference with three interviewers from the IT department. They asked questions regarding my background and customer service skills before switching to questions on technical skills.
Interview Questions: The interviewers asked about my experience supporting workplaces with Windows and Mac workstations.

title: Assistant Professor Interview
Application Type: I applied online. I interviewed at Texas Tech University (Lubbock, TX) in Feb 2022
Interview Descriptions: Very collegial, friendly, respectful interview process over Zoom. Long wait (2 months) to find out the result of the search, but everyone was great in the process. Lots of excellent information provided in interview.
Interview Questions: Tell us about your research.

title: Assistant Professor Interview
Application Type: I applied online. The process took 3 months. I interviewed at Texas Tech University (Lubbock, TX) in Jan 2022
Interview Descriptions:
standard interview and chalk talk.  visit the department to meet with faculty and negotiate start up package and salary. 
standard interview and chalk talk.  visit the department to meet with faculty and negotiate start up package and salary. 
standard interview and chalk talk.  visit the department to meet with faculty and negotiate start up package and salary.
Interview Questions: Describe your research and plan

title: IT - Connectivity Team Leader Interview
Application Type: I applied through college or university. I interviewed at Texas Tech University (You Bet, CA)
Interview Descriptions: How did ruin fhffc go G uh fjubfyu sonebdt. Fdingvrr jkgjiub Christmas is the best time of the year in my opinion our Corporate Engineering team who will support Robinhood’s continued hyper-growth and our Robinhoodies in-office. You will work closely with many teams, including Security, HR, Compliance, and Workplace to support Robinhoodies in their day to day work onsite. The ideal candidate is an excellent communicator with a thirst for solving problems who is looking for an oppor
Interview Questions: Idk I’m not sure why us t hi s dinethinv our Corporate Engineering team who will support Robinhood’s continued hyper-growth and our Robinhoodies in-office. You will work closely with many teams, including Security, HR, Compliance, and Workplace to support Robinhoodies in their day to day work onsite. The ideal candidate is an excellent communicator with a thirst for solving problems who is looking for an oppor

title: Student Assistant Interview
Application Type: I applied online. The process took 1 week. I interviewed at Texas Tech University (Lubbock, TX) in Oct 2021
Interview Descriptions: The interview was simple and fairly easy if you know what you're looking for. As a student assistant, the department is looking for someone who can get the job done and in turn, you get experience to go with your degree.
Interview Questions: What makes you think you will be a good fit for this role?

title: Adjunct Instructor Interview
Application Type: I applied online. The process took 5 days. I interviewed at Texas Tech University in Aug 2021
Interview Descriptions: You first need to fill the application. Then they will review it and contact you. Once they got back to you they will set an interview time. It might be via zoom or call. They will ask questions and give you the offer if you passed the interview
Interview Questions: What do you like the most about teaching and why?

title: Financial Analyst Interview
Application Type: I applied online. I interviewed at Texas Tech University in Aug 2021
Interview Descriptions: The interview was really great. They do take a while throughout the hiring process because there is so many procedures that must be followed. It took about two months but it was worth the wait.
Interview Questions: Tell us about a challenge you faced and how you overcame it.

title: Student Assistant Interview
Application Type: I applied online. I interviewed at Texas Tech University
Interview Descriptions: Email to schedule interview. Phone call for an one-hour interview process. It usually takes one week or less to know the results if you are the right fit. Be prepared to do some research about the department and the school culture.
Interview Questions: Why do you want to work here?

title: IT Support Technician III Interview
Application Type: I applied online. The process took 4 months. I interviewed at Texas Tech University (Lubbock, TX) in Jun 2021
Interview Descriptions:
Straight forward, a few technical questions. There were three interviewers from different depts who had their own questions,how I'd react to a scenario etc.

Not extremely difficult but don't go in the interview without having reviewed your skillset or you'll miss an answer to a quiestion you have the knowledge of but draw a blank.
Interview Questions: why are you a good fit?

title: Professor Interview
Application Type: I applied in-person. The process took 5 days. I interviewed at Texas Tech University (Lubbock, TX) in Jun 2021
Interview Descriptions: how was my previous work place, about Lubback town etc, amenities in town, about airport and connectivity? Fine arms, music and opera scene, facilities in hospital, cooperative approach among peers
Interview Questions: Did you like the city

title: Computer Technician Interview
Application Type: I applied online. I interviewed at Texas Tech University
Interview Descriptions: Fast & Easy. I really didn’t have an interview, more of a run down of the company. I would highly recommend this job to anyone. Great pay as well, nice environment
Interview Questions: How do you deal with stress?

title: Student Assistant Interview
Application Type: I applied through college or university. I interviewed at Texas Tech University in May 2021
Interview Descriptions: The interview process for any student position at Texas Tech Uni is super chill and relaxed! I highly recommend pursuing an undergraduate student assistant job for anyone pursuing a bachelor's.
Interview Questions: "Tell me about yourself", "what are your current aspirations"

title: Rec Sports Staff Interview
Application Type: I interviewed at Texas Tech University
Interview Descriptions: Short, personality style questions. 3 interviewers all very welcoming and talk casually like they are your friends. Not scary at all! Dress business casual - no jeans or t shirts
Interview Questions: Situational questions... what would you do if....

title: Section Manager Interview
Application Type: I interviewed at Texas Tech University
Interview Descriptions: Typical process of a round Robin interview with a panel of 6-8 people asking questions in turn. Good light-hearted conversation and easy going atmosphere. Not difficult at all. I would recommend TTU as employer.
Interview Questions: N/A

title: Tutor Interview
Application Type: I applied through college or university. I interviewed at Texas Tech University
Interview Descriptions: During the interview, I demonstrated lecturing in front of the employers for the classes I wanted to tutor. During the interview, I demonstrated lecturing in front of the employers for the classes I wanted to tutor.
Interview Questions: how would you deal with students who do not actively participate?

title: Student Assistant Interview
Application Type: I interviewed at Texas Tech University
Interview Descriptions: The interview was easy going, they kept it casual. For student assistants they asked what your previous jobs were like. If you knew someone who already worked there you are (almost) always guaranteed an offer
Interview Questions: Where did you last work?

title: Student Assistant Interview
Application Type: I interviewed at Texas Tech University
Interview Descriptions: My interview  was over the phone and went very well. They are trying to see how well you talk on the phone so keep that in mind. It's usually 15 minutes but if it goes longer that means they are interested in you.
Interview Questions: What do you do when someone comes on the phone and they are difficult

title: Product Engineer Interview
Application Type: I interviewed at Texas Tech University
Interview Descriptions: A Product Engineer is a Mechanical Engineer who specializes in designing products and their corresponding manufacturing processes. They are also responsible for transitioning the product from design to manufacturing at scale. ... The role of Product Engineer is a skilled, entry-level position.
Interview Questions: How well do you work with a team

title: Assistant Professor Interview
Application Type: I applied online. I interviewed at Texas Tech University (Lubbock, TX) in Feb 2021
Interview Descriptions:
It was a fake recruitment process.  They already had the person for the position they have opened.  Just make sure you are not wasting your time.  
I don't have any more to say, I think that opening a recruitment process just to guarantee a position of a person that is already inside is very dishonest with those that make an effort to compete for employment.
Interview Questions:
Why do you want to work here?
How do you mentor students?
What is your teaching philosophy?
What are your plans for the following 5 years?
How do you approach inclusion and diversity in the classroom?
What is your research topic?

title: Student Assistant Interview
Application Type: I interviewed at Texas Tech University
Interview Descriptions: Turn in resume, hours capable of working on campus. Email with congratulations on receiving an interview, followed by an interview over Zoom that takes about 15 minutes to complete the process. Notified again by email if received the position or not.
Interview Questions: How would you handle a phone call where someone has been transferred numerous times?

title: Student Assistant Interview
Application Type: I interviewed at Texas Tech University
Interview Descriptions: Pretty straightforward. I submitted my resume and I was asked behavioral as well as technical questions . I was then asked if i'd like to further my career at the company
Interview Questions: How have you handle an unpleasant customer

title: Student Assistant Interview
Application Type: I interviewed at Texas Tech University
Interview Descriptions: Very casual and basic interview questions were asked. Applied through a networking event that allowed me to meet the interviewer before the interview. The interview lasted about 45 minutes and was very conversational based. Lots of behavioral questions were easy to answer.
Interview Questions: Describe some leadership situations that you have had. How did you handle the situation?

title: Undergraduate Student Tutor Interview
Application Type: I applied online. I interviewed at Texas Tech University (Lubbock, TX) in Aug 2020
Interview Descriptions: pretty short, about 30 minutes, through a zoom link. It was pretty good, and the interviewer was pretty chill. They asked a couple of questions and when I was willing to work.
Interview Questions: A little bit about myself and how I was with assisting students

title: Intern Marketing Interview
Application Type: I applied online. I interviewed at Texas Tech University
Interview Descriptions: It was very simple and easy and breezy and lemon squeezy. My interviewer was professional and asked easy simple basic questions. No one should be too worried overall as it is a piece of cake.
Interview Questions: when can you start?

title: PSS Technician Interview
Application Type: I applied online. The process took 2 weeks. I interviewed at Texas Tech University (Amarillo, TX)
Interview Descriptions: Everyone was very nice & helpful.  They asked several relevant questions, but also chatted with me about other things to make the whole process more comfortable.  Overall very good.
Interview Questions: How I would handle specific issues or problems.

title: Student Assistant Interview
Application Type: I applied through an employee referral. The process took 2 days. I interviewed at Texas Tech University
Interview Descriptions: Usual interview questions as expected. Ask about your comfortable age to work with at the center. Asks about past experience and CPR certifications. Short interview. Super easy to talk with coordinator of the center.
Interview Questions: Have you had childcare experience?

title: Research Assistant Interview
Application Type: I applied online. The process took 4 weeks. I interviewed at Texas Tech University (Lubbock, TX)
Interview Descriptions: A lot of phone interviews. Kind and polite.  I got a lot of questions about my previous experiences. Questions about undergrad and master's degrees. I got the offer quickly once I got accepted.
Interview Questions: What are my strengths and weaknesses?

title: Student Assistant Interview
Application Type: I applied online. I interviewed at Texas Tech University (Lubbock, TX) in Dec 2019
Interview Descriptions: Very easy. Asked what I could do to contribute and why I should get the job. Recruiters are very easy to talk too and care about you as a student and individual.
Interview Questions: Why I should hire you.

title: Supplemental Instruction Leader Interview
Application Type: I applied online. I interviewed at Texas Tech University (Lubbock, TX) in Dec 2019
Interview Descriptions: The interview process consisted of a mock instruction session and a classic style interview. One subject is to be covered in the mock session to illustrate that you are capable of teaching something to a college student.
Interview Questions: You made an A in the course, how did you do it?

title: Student Worker Interview
Application Type: I applied online. The process took 3 weeks. I interviewed at Texas Tech University
Interview Descriptions: applied on online, called me two weeks later and after interview call me back in one week. It requires professional references (2 or 3). They definitely call your reference so make sure your reference is not friends or family members and somebody who can tell good things about you.
Interview Questions: what is your most challenging experience

title: Content Writer Interview
Application Type: I applied online. I interviewed at Texas Tech University (El Paso, TX) in Jul 2019
Interview Descriptions: After applying, waited about three weeks.  They reached out and we made appointment and scheduled soon after.  Panel of three interviewed me: one executive and two communications professionals.  I was given a writing task test which was a letter to a potential external partner.
Interview Questions: Why do you want to work here?

title: Research Assistant Interview
Application Type: I applied through college or university. I interviewed at Texas Tech University
Interview Descriptions: It was face to face interview. However, this is the average for one sector of the job market. For others, offers were received within 24 to 48 hours of interviewing—or the hiring process dragged on for weeks. Unfortunately, some employers don't let candidates know one way or another, even after they have interviewed them
Interview Questions:
Previous work experience?
Previous educational background?

title: Student Assistant Interview
Application Type: I applied through college or university. The process took 2 days. I interviewed at Texas Tech University (Lubbock, TX) in May 2019
Interview Descriptions: Studies, schedule, and what I wanted to learn in my role.  They also were interested in my office skills and areas I needed to develop. They asked questions regarding my classes and how those could apply to the  position.
Interview Questions: What classes are you taking that could benefit you in the role?

title: PhD Graduate Student Interview
Application Type: I applied online. I interviewed at Texas Tech University
Interview Descriptions: By the time they've seen your transcript, GRE scores, and letters of recommendation, they've already made their decision.  The interview is effectively just to talk up the program.  It's more about selling you on them than the other way around
Interview Questions: N/A

title: Residence Life Coordinator Interview
Application Type: I applied online. I interviewed at Texas Tech University
Interview Descriptions:
Easy questions with opportunities to communicate transferrable skills. 

After the skype interview, you will be asked for an on campus interview. Save money because if you are offered a position after the on campus but you deny it, you will have to reimburse them for the plane ticket
Interview Questions: Tell me about you and why you are interested in working with students at Texas Tech.

title: Facilities Assistant Interview
Application Type: I applied online. The process took 1 week. I interviewed at Texas Tech University (Lubbock, TX) in Jan 2019
Interview Descriptions: Easy, on the phone, nice people. Called and talked about the position. They offered me a position within the end of the week. Simple job.  I'd recommend getting a student job to everyone.
Interview Questions: strengths and weaknesses

title: Research Assistant Interview
Application Type: I applied in-person. I interviewed at Texas Tech University in Jan 2019
Interview Descriptions: My former advisor interviewed me and asked me about my papers and my research interest, my future goals. I made a presentation about my work and the people in the research group asked me some questions about it. It was an easy interview
Interview Questions: If I am self determined person and explain it with an example

title: Student Assistant Interview
Application Type: I applied through an employee referral. I interviewed at Texas Tech University (Lubbock, TX) in Jan 2019
Interview Descriptions: The interview was quick and easy. The staff was pleasant and welcoming. I was a student assistant in the Career Development Center at Texas Tech University for Student Engagement and Organizations.
Interview Questions: What are your strengths and weaknesses?

title: Student Assistant Interview
Application Type: I applied online. The process took 1 week. I interviewed at Texas Tech University (Lubbock, TX) in Dec 2018
Interview Descriptions: Asked simple questions and flexibility of schedule, should be able to work for 10 or more hours a week.  Suggested that we should have good communication and people skills. Have to be able to ask for help when needed, may not know all the questions asked by patrons so cannot be too shy to ask a supervisor for help when needed.
Interview Questions: When will you be able to work

title: Student Technician Interview
Application Type: I applied through college or university. The process took 2 weeks. I interviewed at Texas Tech University (Lubbock, TX) in Nov 2018
Interview Descriptions: Situational Questions including what steps you would take to fix different issues that may come up.  The interview process was pretty chill overall. (Most of the Technical parts will be tought in the training process after being hired)
Interview Questions: What are the steps you would take to fix different computer issues

title: Student Assistant - SBS Interview
Application Type: I applied through an employee referral. The process took 2 weeks. I interviewed at Texas Tech University (Lubbock, TX) in Sept 2018
Interview Descriptions: Entrevista feita em 3 etapas. Primeiro contato por telefone, pelo gerente da área. Segunda etapa: entrevista presencial com os três gerentes das diferentes áreas do departamento. E por último uma entrevista final com o responsável superior do departamento.
Interview Questions: Você prefere atender clientes pessoalmente, através de email, telefone ou processar documentação?

title: Assistant Professor Interview
Application Type: I interviewed at Texas Tech University
Interview Descriptions: The interview was a great experience. It was conducted in a fair manner with good, fair questions about appropriate and important topics relevant to the job. The interviewers listened well and provided good answers to my questions.
Interview Questions: Describe your planned research program.

title: Graduate Assistant Interview
Application Type: I applied online. The process took 3 weeks. I interviewed at Texas Tech University in Aug 2018
Interview Descriptions: The process was easy- I was contacted within a week of applying online. We first did a skype interview since I was in Dallas, and did an in person interview when I arrived in lubbock. I got an offer within the next few hours after my in person interview.
Interview Questions: Tell us about a time you or a friend were experiencing a crisis and how you managed it?

title: Space Planning Analyst Interview
Application Type: I applied online. The process took 2 months. I interviewed at Texas Tech University (Lubbock, TX)
Interview Descriptions: The interview has to be in the normal working hours, no possibility of after hours interview for people who are already working and looking to change.  Interview is about 1hr.
Interview Questions: What is something you struggle with?

title: TA Interview
Application Type: I interviewed at Texas Tech University
Interview Descriptions:
The interview process is very simple. If you are well prepared, I think you will pass it. You should   
be confident. If you have past working experience, it will be better.
Interview Questions: Can you let me know your past working exprience

title: Tutor Interview
Application Type: I applied in-person. I interviewed at Texas Tech University
Interview Descriptions:
Interview at the TECHniques Center.

The interview process was very friendly and non-intimidating. Ask basic "Get to know you" questions. You will meet with an Academic Counselor as well as a Master Tutor. Very good about explaining next steps in the process.
Interview Questions: What do you know about the TECHniques Center/

title: Student Assistant Interview
Application Type: I applied in-person. I interviewed at Texas Tech University (Lubbock, TX)
Interview Descriptions: The whole process was very laid back. It was your typical interview with really friendly people. Look up interview questions online and you should be adamantly prepared. It only took about two weeks to get the job and I started working the week after that.
Interview Questions: What is your greatest weakness?

title: Student Assistant Interview
Application Type: I applied in-person. I interviewed at Texas Tech University
Interview Descriptions: It was just as easy as emailing a resume, then setting up a meeting with the department head and talking about job requirements as well as hours. Very easy process.
Interview Questions: How do you manage your time?

title: Associate Director - Athletics Human Resources Interview
Application Type: I applied online. The process took 3 weeks. I interviewed at Texas Tech University (New York, NY)
Interview Descriptions: I applied online and was contacted for a phone interview. I’m very disappointed (and could tell from my interview with the two men that conducted it) that they were only interviewing me for legality reasons. They did not ask me one question that would have given them preview to my ability to effectively do the job at hand. I later found that they promoted someone internally who had no HR experience yet that’s all they spoke about in the interview; the need to have experience to build the program and policies up. It’s not lost on me that, especially in the athletics department, it operates as the ‘good ol’ boys’ club. A word of advice: in the future, don’t waste people’s time.  It’s unprincipled and disreputable.
Interview Questions: Can you handle working with different levels of management?

title: Student Assistant Interview
Application Type: I applied through an employee referral. I interviewed at Texas Tech University (Lubbock, TX) in Dec 2017
Interview Descriptions: First I worried so much but the interview was not hard. It was one to one interview. The questions were very easy to answer. But It is better to prepare well for the interview.
Interview Questions: Tell us about your self

title: Student Assistant Interview
Application Type: I applied through college or university. I interviewed at Texas Tech University (Lubbock, TX) in Oct 2017
Interview Descriptions: The interview process was with two associates that were very respectful with great good questioning about my background and work experience.  They asked me various  questions about my skillset in different jobs.
Interview Questions: What is a strength of yours?

title: Student Assistant Interview
Application Type: I applied online. I interviewed at Texas Tech University
Interview Descriptions: It was really easy since they were looking to hire asap. I went in, and was given a tour around the Library and was explained about the job requirements. The the supervisor told me that he only interviewed me and another girl and I was the best fit. He offered me the position then.
Interview Questions: Basic behavioral questions.

title: Shift Manager Interview
Application Type: I applied through college or university. I interviewed at Texas Tech University in Sept 2017
Interview Descriptions:
Simple interview process. Quick on the decision.
The area manager interviewed me and I got hired as an associate for 6 months and got promoted to manager. Work schedules are flexible.
Interview Questions: Qualification, Past Experience, Job Scenarios

title: Media Relations Coordinator Interview
Application Type: I applied online. I interviewed at Texas Tech University (Lubbock, TX) in Sept 2017
Interview Descriptions: The interview was a good experience! I interviewed at the College of Visual & Performing Arts. The campus and building were great, as well as the panel of interviewers. Really the whole experience was great. I traveled for the 2 interviews and they were very welcoming and attentive. The interview was general questions about me and skills related to the job. In the end, I was offered the position, but the salary was much lower than I expected. They were only able to come up a little bit, and it still would have been a significant pay cut from my current job, so I turned it down. But that was literally the only reason.
Interview Questions: What attracted you to this position?

title: Nurse Interview
Application Type: I interviewed at Texas Tech University
Interview Descriptions: The interview was not difficult or nerve-racking at all. The interviewers were friendly, professional, and welcoming. They did a great job of helping me feel comfortable enough to talk calmly and enthusiastically about myself which ensures they'd get the real me and not just a part of it.
Interview Questions: What would you do if you find yourself struggling in a nursing course?

title: Student Assistant Interview
Application Type: I applied online. The process took 2 weeks. I interviewed at Texas Tech University (Lubbock, TX) in Aug 2017
Interview Descriptions: It was 1-3 questions. The question were really easy. This is basically a first time job for students so you don't have to stress at all. Just be yourself and you will be fine. The hours suck and the pay is meh.
Interview Questions: What does customer service mean to you

title: Research Assistant Interview
Application Type: I applied through college or university. The process took 1 week. I interviewed at Texas Tech University (Lubbock, TX) in Aug 2017
Interview Descriptions: It was a basic technical interview related to asp.net. They asked me to explain about the projects where I used asp.net.  What are the difficulties I faced ?
Interview Questions: Explain about the project where you have used asp.net

title: Instructor Interview
Application Type: I applied in-person. I interviewed at Texas Tech University
Interview Descriptions: It was a face to face interview where I spoke to the chair of the department and offered me with current post. The process was fast and efficient. Since they knew me ahead of time while I was a PhD student, the approval was not difficult.
Interview Questions: What kind of teaching experience you have before?

title: Academic Advisor Interview
Application Type: I applied online. I interviewed at Texas Tech University
Interview Descriptions: I received a response to my submitted application in a timely manner. They first requested a phone interview. During the interview the three individuals on the phone were polite, engaging, and actively listened to my responses. Within 3 or 4 days I received a phone call for a follow-up in-person interview.
Interview Questions: Describe a time when you were confronted with a conflict and the steps you took to resolve that conflict.

title: Enterprise Network Engineer Interview
Application Type: I applied online. I interviewed at Texas Tech University (Lubbock, TX) in Jun 2017
Interview Descriptions: Applied and received an email that i was selected for an interview. Was very stress free process. Great Interview. Very professional interviewers. Unfortunately was not selected for the job. If i were to redo anything in this process, i would have maybe touched up on some technical things first.
Interview Questions:
What do i bring specifically to the Engineer Staff?
What hardware and software are you comfortable with?
What kind of environment are you better in, group or independent?

title: Graduate Research Assistant Interview
Application Type: I applied through college or university. The process took 6 days. I interviewed at Texas Tech University (Lubbock, TX) in Apr 2017
Interview Descriptions:
•	Performed data analysis on the acquired data and successfully increased the OEE metric, availability and 
performance of production machines by 10%
•	Led and provided practical and pragmatic solutions to technical issues. This CO-OP helped me in enhancing my communication skills as well as project management skills
Interview Questions: Are you ready?

title: Graduate Assistant Interview
Application Type: I applied through college or university. I interviewed at Texas Tech University (Lubbock, TX) in Apr 2017
Interview Descriptions: A couple of rounds. No dragging, they shoot questions based on stuff related to job requirements. If you got 80% of skills mentioned in the job description, go ahead and apply and lead a peaceful life.
Interview Questions: Leadership Quality experience!

title: Programmer Analyst Interview
Application Type: I applied through an employee referral. The process took 4 weeks. I interviewed at Texas Tech University
Interview Descriptions: A couple of skype interviews and some in person interviews. Generally pretty straight forward questions. Only a couple of technical based questions. Mostly tried to see if you would fit the culture and be able to work with the people there.
Interview Questions: What changes can you implement to the classroom technology to improve it?

title: Research Assistant Interview
Application Type: I applied through college or university. I interviewed at Texas Tech University
Interview Descriptions: I applied online. I received a phone call within 48 hours about scheduling an interview. The interview was very straightforward. The following week, I went into the office and interviewed with my potential boss. He described the position. Overall, the experience was very easy.
Interview Questions: Why should we hire you? Tell me a little bit about yourself

title: Human Resources Senior Analyst- Employee Relations Interview
Application Type: The process took 3 months. I interviewed at Texas Tech University
Interview Descriptions: I was not contacted for almost 4 months after applying. As a result I didn't expect to hear from them for an interview. But I went in and met with the Assoc Director and Section Manager. They asked a lot of standard questions then proceeded to some situational scenarios. I was told that they would make a decision by the end of the week. They did not get back in touch with me till the following week. They decided to only hire one person rather than the two that were originally open.
Interview Questions: Describe your ideal supervisor.

title: Senior Analyst - Human Resources Labor Relations Interview
Application Type: I applied online. The process took 4 weeks. I interviewed at Texas Tech University (Little Elm, TX)
Interview Descriptions: Applied online. Took 3-4 weeks for them to contact me. I live in Dallas so they were very willing to do a Skype interview with me versus having me drive to Lubbock. First I had a phone screen, then the Skype interview. Interviewed with the HR director and HR Section manager over talent. They were both extremely friendly and knowledgeable.
Interview Questions: Asked a lot of situational questions that had to do with HR situations that I could be expected to handle in the role I was applying for.

title: Student Assistant Interview
Application Type: I applied through college or university. The process took 2 days. I interviewed at Texas Tech University (Lubbock, TX) in Aug 2016
Interview Descriptions: The interview process is something you shouldn't be nervous about. I had a group interview and the individuals were nice down to earth folks. If they feel you are the same then you will most likely get the position. Of course, you must be competent.
Interview Questions: Tell me about yourself?

title: Assistant Facilities Manager Interview
Application Type: I applied through an employee referral. The process took 5 days. I interviewed at Texas Tech University (Lubbock, TX) in Aug 2016
Interview Descriptions: It was very comfortable. I was very nervous but the interviewer made me feel relaxed after a few questions.  She was very nice and resourceful. It was an overall positive experience.
Interview Questions: Have you ever worked in customer service?

title: Student Assistant Interview
Application Type: I applied through an employee referral. I interviewed at Texas Tech University
Interview Descriptions: The interview for student Assistant position is pretty easy if you are selected by reference. The interview questions are pretty the same for every student. It mostly depends on your schedule, hours you would like to work.
Interview Questions: Tell me about yourself.?

title: Student Assistant Interview
Application Type: I applied through an employee referral. The process took 1 week. I interviewed at Texas Tech University (Lubbock, TX) in May 2016
Interview Descriptions: Formal, but very casual. Behavioral questions, and questions about past work experiences. Not threatening at all. Everyone is super friendly throughout the process. Just make sure to be confident with your answers and be able to provide evidence/examples to back up your answers.
Interview Questions: How would you describe yourself professionally in three words?

title: Development Officer Interview
Application Type: I applied online. I interviewed at Texas Tech University (Lubbock, TX) in May 2016
Interview Descriptions: I had an initial phone interview and then an in-person interview; The interview lasted about an hour where they asked me on my experience in higher education development and went over scenarios.
Interview Questions: What experience do you have in development?

title: Graduate Assistant Interview
Application Type: I applied through college or university. I interviewed at Texas Tech University
Interview Descriptions: I was invited to go on campus at Texas Tech. My host was very nice and took me around town. I also had the chance of meeting other 7 candidates. The interview process was formal OPE style with 3 interview sessions.
Interview Questions: Tell us about yourself

title: Manager Interview
Application Type: I applied online. The process took 1+ week. I interviewed at Texas Tech University (New York, NY) in Mar 2016
Interview Descriptions: Your work schedule, though flexible, is set for anywhere from a 3-6 month period. The pay is excellent but the environment can be very stressful. Management is mostly competent and helpful, but a few bad eggs do make it through. Reaching out above the normal escalation path is frowned upon, so getting to your boss' boss is difficult without them knowing.
Interview Questions: Your work schedule, though flexible, is set for anywhere from a 3-6 month period. The pay is excellent but the environment can be very stressful. Management is mostly competent and helpful, but a few bad eggs do make it through. Reaching out above the normal escalation path is frowned upon, so getting to your boss' boss is difficult without them knowing.

title: Student Assistant Interview
Application Type: I applied online. The process took 1 week. I interviewed at Texas Tech University (Lubbock, TX) in Feb 2016
Interview Descriptions: I applied online and received a call within a week, then we scheduled a date that worked for both of us.  Once arriving at the location, i was interviewed by my supervisor then the head of the department.
Interview Questions: Why do you want be a student assistant?

title: Student Assistant Interview
Application Type: I applied in-person. I interviewed at Texas Tech University (Lubbock, TX) in Jan 2016
Interview Descriptions: It was formal, where they asked behavioral questions about me. There were three interviews. The first one being the executive assistant and the others added senior staff to the interview. The interview was not very difficult. They asked a lot about myself and how I ended up at tech, then they wanted to know what experience I had in the field that would pertain to working as a student assistant
Interview Questions: Tell me a time when you overcame adversity

title: Library Assistant Interview
Application Type: I applied online. The process took 2 weeks. I interviewed at Texas Tech University (Lubbock, TX) in Jan 2016
Interview Descriptions: it was a situational type questionnaire. it went quickly and i received a response a couple of days later. it is a hard job to have and to get an interview is very hard.
Interview Questions: how would you be described by your best friend

title: Student Assistant Interview
Application Type: I applied online. The process took 1 day. I interviewed at Texas Tech University (Lubbock, TX) in Jan 2016
Interview Descriptions: The interview consisted of meeting with the manager of the department and discussing the position. They asked questions about the job and about Technology in general as I was applying for an I.T. position.
Interview Questions: How would you explain to a customer why they need to update their OS?

title: Sports Official Interview
Application Type: I applied in-person. The process took 3 days. I interviewed at Texas Tech University (Lubbock, TX) in Jan 2016
Interview Descriptions: Really easy. They just ask you for a few specific items for pay purposes. It takes a few days for training and Texas Tech procedures for regular season and playoffs. There are no real interview questions.
Interview Questions: N/A

title: Maintenance Engineer Interview
Application Type: I applied online. The process took 4 weeks. I interviewed at Texas Tech University (Lubbock, TX) in Jan 2016
Interview Descriptions: I graduated as a MSME at Texas Tech  and I have more than 10yrs experiences as a Maintenance Engineer and they send me email says I'm not qualified. I did not get it. I think they do not believe their engineering programs or they have a very insufficient HR department
Interview Questions: I did not get any question

title: Graduate Assistant Interview
Application Type: I applied through college or university. I interviewed at Texas Tech University (Lubbock, TX) in Dec 2015
Interview Descriptions: I had only one round in the interview process. The questions were mainly based on the resume and the questions were based on their requirements based on our resume .
Interview Questions: Recent Projects?

title: Residence Life Coordinator Interview
Application Type: I applied in-person. The process took 2 weeks. I interviewed at Texas Tech University (Lubbock, TX) in Dec 2015
Interview Descriptions: I applied online through the University HR system. I then had a phone interview with two individuals. I was then offered an on campus interview. I met with a few of the senior management 1:1 and then had a series of three interviews that day. The interviews were with the managements level, peers, and students.
Interview Questions: Crisis Response

title: Aquatic Supervisor Interview
Application Type: I applied in-person. The process took 1 day. I interviewed at Texas Tech University
Interview Descriptions:
required to have six months experience before applying for supervisor role
very easy process
Interview was split into 2 sections; the first was a scenario to see how you reacted during an emergency, second part was an interview with the aquatics director and the current supervisors
Interview Questions: What would you bring to the team?

title: Graduate Research Assistant Interview
Application Type: I applied in-person. The process took 1 week. I interviewed at Texas Tech University (Lubbock, TX) in Oct 2015
Interview Descriptions: It was very brief interview with some question about my background and my experiences and also some question about my past jobs and my work ethics. It was a very warm and friendly session with the director and one of the staff and It didn't take too long.
Interview Questions: How do you solve a problem?

title: Section Coordinator Interview
Application Type: I applied online. The process took 2+ months. I interviewed at Texas Tech University (El Paso, TX) in Sept 2015
Interview Descriptions: Contacted within 4 weeks to interview. Interview location not properly clarified. They asked me all kinds of questions; but, they never hire me. Not certain, but, could be racially related as I am partially African American.
Interview Questions: General

title: Academic Advisor Interview
Application Type: I applied through an employee referral. The process took 2 weeks. I interviewed at Texas Tech University (Lubbock, TX) in Sept 2015
Interview Descriptions: Applied online with an application and cover letter. Was called for an interview and arranged it for a few days later. They were very good about working with my schedule.
Interview Questions: What do you know about our department?

title: Research Assistant Interview
Application Type: I applied in-person. I interviewed at Texas Tech University
Interview Descriptions:
I was given the job. No interview was required as the entire performance during the first year of graduate studies was evaluated as crieteria for enrolling as research assistant.
Students at Texas Tech have a flexible program where during the second year we are given the option of either taking up an internship research project under one of the professors guidance or at an industry for one year.
Research assistanship is given based on project similarities
Interview Questions:
Basic knowledge about molecular biology and RNA
Nucleic acid extraction
quantification
Sequencing knowledge
Illumina synthesis chemistry

title: Programmer/Analyst II Interview
Application Type: I applied online. The process took 1+ week. I interviewed at Texas Tech University
Interview Descriptions: Straightforward questions about background, experience and education. I was interview by two people. It was a relaxed interview. The hiring process was fast. I got the job offer the same day granted I passed the background check.
Interview Questions: Why do you want to be in higher ed?

title: Programmer Analyst III Interview
Application Type: I applied online. The process took 3 weeks. I interviewed at Texas Tech University (Lubbock, TX) in Aug 2015
Interview Descriptions: The interview process involves a Tex/as Tech University department manager to call you or email you to setup a time to interview.  This isn't always easy because they have limited time for them to get a their staff to be able to meet.  They usually have between five and ten people and includes the manager's manager, the manager him/herself, two or three people that work in the department that would be involved with your position, one or two people from the user community, and possibly 1 or two graduate students.  They ask you about yourself, tell you about the job and then ask questions to check your knowledge.  Some technical programming or database departments have a fairly difficult programming assignment that sometimes is done right there in the interview.  That is stressful, but the people are very nice about it.  Sometimes, there is a take home assignment.  These are even more difficult, but they give you a week to return the results.
Interview Questions: One of the questions that i got was to solve a moderately difficult recursive function in Javascript.  I was to find the error in it and tell them what it was supposed to do.  That was done at the interview table and they gave me all the time I needed, but they sat there and watched me solve it and waited until I finished.

title: Study Abroad Student Assistant Interview
Application Type: I applied through an employee referral. The process took 1 day. I interviewed at Texas Tech University (Lubbock, TX) in Aug 2015
Interview Descriptions: Submitted a resume and cover letter after my former study abroad advisor recommended I apply to the position. Got a call that they wanted an interview. Interview lasted approximately 30 minutes, all the normal questions. Really (obviously) wanted to hear how my study abroad experience would help me with my job. Looking for a personable student who could talk to both students and administrators with equal professionalism.
Interview Questions: If you could have any super power, what would it be?

title: Instructor Interview
Application Type: I applied through other source. The process took 1 day. I interviewed at Texas Tech University (Lubbock, TX) in Aug 2015
Interview Descriptions: As I was a graduate student and teacher before my full-time position, the hiring management already knew me and knew I was a capable instructor. I was accepted without any interview.
Interview Questions: They didn't ask me anything besides my prefered teaching schedule.

title: Teaching Assistant Interview
Application Type: I applied through college or university. The process took 1 week. I interviewed at Texas Tech University (Lubbock, TX) in Aug 2015
Interview Descriptions: Department selects the TA from the graduate students. Departmental advisor or professor should recommended you. Need to talk with your professor/ departmental chair. For an international student need to attend the ITA workshop. They will certify the communication skills.
Interview Questions: There was no interview question. Just need to pass ITA workshop.

title: Research Assistant Interview
Application Type: I applied through an employee referral. I interviewed at Texas Tech University in Aug 2015
Interview Descriptions: It was an interesting process. Interview was based on some database concepts and discussion about the projects I have done.. It was a telephonic interview and then skype interview. I was notified about my selection through email.
Interview Questions: What is Tableau? My recent projects? Introduce yourself? Database concepts? Do you have anay questions for us? What do you do to manage time?

title: Teaching Assistant Interview
Application Type: I applied through college or university. The process took 4 weeks. I interviewed at Texas Tech University in Aug 2015
Interview Descriptions: there were no interview, you need to attend a workshop course fro one week, where you will have to go under different kind of assessment including presentation skills, communications skills, and speaking skills.
Interview Questions: Explain  to me any topic related to your major?

title: Student Assistant Interview
Application Type: I applied through other source. The process took 5 days. I interviewed at Texas Tech University (Lubbock, TX) in Aug 2015
Interview Descriptions: I was able to hear about the job from a friend. I contacted a secretary in the office and she initially screened me in a very short impromptu interview. This interview was just general information about myself and my availability. She then got into some job details. I was then set up with an interview with an Associate Dean. This was the actual interview where we discussed my roles in depth.
Interview Questions: What is your GPA?

title: Student Assistant Interview
Application Type: I applied through an employee referral. The process took 1 day. I interviewed at Texas Tech University (Lubbock, TX) in Aug 2015
Interview Descriptions: I was recommended for the position by one of my professors so i did not have to go through so much scrutiny as every other applicant. I got an email and was asked to meet with the hiring officer, who only gave me instructions on how to set up my employee account. It was a smooth interview because I was recommended by the professor based on my performance in His class.
Interview Questions: The only questions asked where, If i felt comfortable doing the Job, and If I would have enough time to do the Job

title: Resident Physician Interview
Application Type: I applied online. The process took 1 day. I interviewed at Texas Tech University (El Paso, TX)
Interview Descriptions: Panel of 4 faculty will interview. A tour in the hospital. Lunch is provided. The interview day is proceeded by dinner with the residents at the Double Tree Hotel. Residents are friendly and nice.
Interview Questions: Why El Paso Texas Tech?

title: Research Associate Professor Interview
Application Type: I applied online. The process took 2 months. I interviewed at Texas Tech University in Jul 2015
Interview Descriptions: I interviewed with the professor. I gave a job talk and went out to lunch with a group that didn't say much of anything. Professor took over 2 months to send an offer letter. This should have been a red flag at his management ineptitude.
Interview Questions: Why do you want to work at Tech?

title: Medical Billing Specialist Interview
Application Type: I applied online. The process took 1 day. I interviewed at Texas Tech University (Lubbock, TX) in Jul 2015
Interview Descriptions: Interviews process consisted of 5 members of managment. I would describe it as relaxed and friendly. I felt the interview questions were fair. It was a good experience. I felt very comfortable during the interview process.
Interview Questions: What is strengths and weaknesses

title: Marketing Assistant Interview
Application Type: I applied through an employee referral. The process took 1 week. I interviewed at Texas Tech University (Lubbock, TX) in May 2015
Interview Descriptions: in-person interview with the team. After an offer- drug and background check. You meet with the Marketing Director and which ever manager is in charge of the area you will focus in.
Interview Questions: "What kind of car would you be and why"

title: Program Analyst Interview
Application Type: I applied online. I interviewed at Texas Tech University (Lubbock, TX) in Apr 2015
Interview Descriptions:
Technical Interview and then HR Interview.
The shortlist was done directly based on resumes. In the technical interview, OOPS concepts, OS, DBMS questions were asked.
OS: thrashing, deadlock, virtual memory
DBMS: triggers, cursors 
OOPS: virtual constructors, run time polymorphism, static functions, inheritance. Questions based on projects done.
Interview Questions: There was no Aptitude round. They shortlisted based on our Resume. I had one technical round at first in which he asked questions from C,C++ (polymorphism). And then he asked whether I can write interrupt service routines. I said no. Then he asked me a testing question,which I think I did well. Then he asked me some more questions on some concepts.

title: Student Assistant Interview
Application Type: I applied through an employee referral. The process took 3 days. I interviewed at Texas Tech University (Lubbock, TX) in Mar 2015
Interview Descriptions: One of my friends who was working at the library referred me to the manager and I got a phone call after 2 days to attend the interview and I got the job
Interview Questions: Tell me about yourself, Do you gave any previous experience, how do you deal with the patrons

title: Post Doctoral Research Associate Interview
Application Type: I applied in-person. The process took 1 day. I interviewed at Texas Tech University (Lubbock, TX) in Mar 2015
Interview Descriptions: Sat down and spoke with the professor I would be working with in the College of Agriculture. It was very relaxed and not very stressful at all. We then went to look at the lab facilities in the building and toured the research farm where I met graduate students working with the professor. Finally, I met briefly with the dean of the department.
Interview Questions: What are your personal research interests and what experience do you have with cotton.

title: Graduate Assistant Interview
Application Type: I applied through college or university. The process took 1 day. I interviewed at Texas Tech University (Lubbock, TX) in Jan 2015
Interview Descriptions: I was asked about my previous work experience. Couple of behavioral questions and my capabilities. 2 interviewers and 1 interviewer from remote. Received job offer in a week with scholarship and in-state tuition fee waiver along with good hourly pay
Interview Questions: How good am I with Java

title: Student Assistant Interview
Application Type: I applied in-person. I interviewed at Texas Tech University (Lubbock, TX) in Jan 2015
Interview Descriptions: The hiring process went smooth. First started with interview. The hiring manager was very understanding person and scheduled interview in my time schedule. I submitted all the required documents and I was onboard.
Interview Questions: How did you manage a conflict?

title: Graduate Assistant Interview
Application Type: I applied online. The process took 4 weeks. I interviewed at Texas Tech University (Lubbock, TX) in Nov 2014
Interview Descriptions: I worked for the position of Graduate Assistant at Texas Tech Application Development and Support. Interview was 20/25 mins long. They mostly asked about project I worked on during my undergrad. What are my expertise's. When am I going to be graduate! They discussed about the job responsibilities as well.
Interview Questions:
1.Projects I worked on?
2. Biggest challenges I faced doing the projects?

title: Community Advisor Interview
Application Type: I applied online. I interviewed at Texas Tech University (Lubbock, TX)
Interview Descriptions: First round of interviewing involved sitting with a current Community Advisor and a full-time department worker.  It was simple question and answer, and none of the questions really caught me off guard.  The next day I attended a group interview involving three activities.  First I and many other candidates sat around a panel and we answered questions regarding how would would rank our work priorities and we came to a group decision.  The next was a physical group puzzle we had to figure out with other applicants.  Lastly we were put with a partner and asked to create an educational program for a random learning community.  About a week later I received a job offer with assignment.  I accepted.  I filled out background check and took a urine drug test.
Interview Questions: "How would you interact with a diverse group of residents and connect with them?"

title: Marketing Supervisor Interview
Application Type: I applied through other source. The process took 1 day. I interviewed at Texas Tech University (Lubbock, TX) in Sept 2014
Interview Descriptions: It was definitely more about personality than it was about experience. They found my resume from a previous application and that was really cool. It really was a great experience.
Interview Questions: Create a social media campaign

title: Research Assistant Interview
Application Type: I applied online. The process took 5 days. I interviewed at Texas Tech University (Lubbock, TX) in Sept 2014
Interview Descriptions: Interview process is very quick. they do not keep you waiting for results after interview. I applied for the job and I got a call for an interview in 2 to 3 days. Interview was technical and focused on job requirements. Interviewer explained all job responsibilities and duties one need to perform on job. After interview I got mail with job offer on same day.
Interview Questions: Tell me about your previous work experience

title: Student Assistant Interview
Application Type: I applied through a recruiter. I interviewed at Texas Tech University (Lubbock, TX) in Sept 2014
Interview Descriptions: I was under a mentor/protege program and my mentor, a unit coordinator at the time, was assisting on finding me a job. After consulting with an Associate Director, I was offered a part time position. I automatically accepted the offer and started working the following week.
Interview Questions: How can you manage administrative services while continuing your education at Texas Tech?

title: Graduate Assistant Interview
Application Type: I applied through college or university. The process took 2 weeks. I interviewed at Texas Tech University (Lubbock, TX) in Sept 2014
Interview Descriptions: The Interview Process went for Half an Hour and I was interviewed by a 4 member team.The interview was average and they tested my SQL and web technology background.Since it is a Graduate Assistant position,previous work experience is not mandatory but an add-on skill.They mainly test if we have the technical knowledge and willingness to learn.
Interview Questions: They asked my experience with SQL and ASP.NET and if I had previous experience in php.

title: Senior Evaluator Interview
Application Type: I applied online. The process took 2 weeks. I interviewed at Texas Tech University (Lubbock, TX) in Aug 2014
Interview Descriptions: Hiring process takes a while, a lot of paperwork and background check to go through. Once hired have to go through new employee orientation and benefits training. If working with student records have to take training test.
Interview Questions: What is your biggest weakness

title: Tutor Interview
Application Type: I applied in-person. The process took 1 week. I interviewed at Texas Tech University (Lubbock, TX) in Aug 2014
Interview Descriptions: A typical interview was conducted which began with questions about oneself and any relevant experience. It was soon followed by some facts about my grades in my past courses. I was also asked about how I intend to approach a difficult situation with some students if need be.
Interview Questions: How do you explain the shortcomings in some of your past courses?

title: Student Assistant Interview
Application Type: I interviewed at Texas Tech University
Interview Descriptions: Emailed the director and he gave me a time and place to meet with him and other staff members. He took a while to get back to me, but they were at a point where they were desperate for help and he finally contacted me.
Interview Questions: Just asked how well I worked with computers

title: Residence Life Coordinator Interview
Application Type: I applied online. I interviewed at Texas Tech University (Lubbock, TX) in Jun 2014
Interview Descriptions: 1 phone interview, 1 skype interview, on site interview (full day). Very easy and typical RLC questions in regards to how you handle situations, event planning, conduct situations, supervision, conflict mediation.
Interview Questions: N/A

title: Student Assistant Interview
Application Type: I applied online. The process took 1 day. I interviewed at Texas Tech University in Jun 2014
Interview Descriptions: none to speak of, simply applied to the position and received the position. great place for students to work when they are younger and not having to support themselves personally
Interview Questions: none, simply asked If I would like the position

title: Student Assistant Interview
Application Type: I applied online. The process took 3 days. I interviewed at Texas Tech University (Lubbock, TX) in Jun 2014
Interview Descriptions: The job interview process can be lengthy. Being interviewed once and getting a job offer is typically a thing of the past. Today, many companies have an involved interview process starting with screening interviews, followed by in-person interviews, second interviews and even third interviews.
Interview Questions: Basic Interview questions

title: Teaching Assistant Interview
Application Type: I applied through college or university. The process took 1 day. I interviewed at Texas Tech University (Lubbock, TX) in May 2014
Interview Descriptions: It was very easy. You fill out a form online about your teaching experience (if you have any) and what classes you are taking with a few other questions. I went through a short interview where they basically just asked me about my previous job experience and looked at my resume.
Interview Questions: What duites did you perform in your previous jobs?

title: Unit Coordinator Interview
Application Type: I applied through an employee referral. The process took 6 months. I interviewed at Texas Tech University (Lubbock, TX) in May 2014
Interview Descriptions: Series of several interviews including phone screening, 5 in-person one-on-one interviews with personnel that I would work with, and one group/panel interview. Interview process even included a real-life scenario skills quiz. The process took 6 months.
Interview Questions: Share a time you faced adversity and how you overcame it.

title: IT Student Assistant Interview
Application Type: I applied through college or university. The process took 1 week. I interviewed at Texas Tech University (Lubbock, TX) in May 2014
Interview Descriptions: Fairly easy, basic understanding of computers is required. They'll also ask about your class schedule and how many hours you can work a week. Also, interview is conducted with 2 - 4 upper level staff.
Interview Questions: Do you know about computer hardware?

title: Research Assistant Interview
Application Type: I interviewed at Texas Tech University
Interview Descriptions:
GRC is organizing nearly 600 Conferences and Seminars in 2014 and 2015. Meetings will be held in New England, California and Texas in the United States, and internationally in Italy, Spain and Hong Kong, China. Click the Conferences menu on the left for a complete list of meetings.

For over 75 years, GRC's high-quality, cost-effective meetings have been recognized as the world's premier scientific conferences, where leading investigators from around the globe discuss their latest work and future challenges in a uniquely informal, interactive format. Apply to a Gordon Research Conference or Gordon Research Seminar now and see why attendees consistently rate them "the best conference I've attended this year".
Interview Questions: N/A

title: Student Assistant Interview
Application Type: I applied through an employee referral. The process took 1 week. I interviewed at Texas Tech University (Lubbock, TX) in Mar 2014
Interview Descriptions: Applied online got and friend already working there referred me email for the interview. interview was very simple and easy.Questions like, if working part time will affect my education in any way ? s also asked about team work and have i ever had conflicts in the team before ? would i be needing supervision to work etc.Got the reply via email about joining date
Interview Questions: Most of the questions were behavioral and how can i work in a team ?

title: Graduate Research Assistant Interview
Application Type: I applied through college or university. The process took 2 days. I interviewed at Texas Tech University (Lubbock, TX)
Interview Descriptions: Communicated with my supervisor during classes. Discussed opportunities and projects.
Interview Questions: What is experience related to Next Gen Sequencing?

title: Student Assistant Interview
Application Type: I applied online. The process took 2 weeks. I interviewed at Texas Tech University
Interview Descriptions: I applied through an online job posting and received a call within the same week. The recruiter asked few questions over the phone and proceeded to schedule an in-person interview with the manager and assistant manager. I was told to send him documentation afterwards and I received an offer a day later.
Interview Questions: What are your best leadership skills?

title: Graduate Research Assistant Interview
Application Type: I applied through college or university. The process took 3 months. I interviewed at Texas Tech University (Lubbock, TX)
Interview Descriptions: I contacted a professor at TTU about my interest in attending grad school there. We communicated via email and set up a time for me to visit and meet with several professors to see where I fit in best. I was given a tour of the facilities and met with other students. The meetings with each professor were very casual, and they were all interested in finding the best place for me. It was overall a pleasant and low pressure experience.
Interview Questions: The interview was more of an informal meeting to get to know each other. We discussed my expectations and theirs as well as my past experience and research interests.

title: IT Help Central Desktop Support Student Assistant Interview
Application Type: I applied through college or university. The process took 3 weeks. I interviewed at Texas Tech University (Lubbock, TX)
Interview Descriptions: Signed up for an interview online; got a phone call to come in and interview. Got the job days later.
Interview Questions: Tell us about your experience in IT

title: Research Assistant Interview
Application Type: I applied through college or university. The process took 5 days. I interviewed at Texas Tech University
Interview Descriptions: Just a casual interview with some technical questions.
Interview Questions: nothing like that. good knowledge on your projects is a plus

title: Assistant Professor Interview
Application Type: I applied online. I interviewed at Texas Tech University (Lubbock, TX) in Feb 2014
Interview Descriptions: initial selection through telephone and then on campus. The head of the committee seemed distracted and forgot to tell me general planning details. The rest of the individuals I met were cordial and gave me a good impression of the town
Interview Questions: What draws you to this job.

title: Prep Cook Interview
Application Type: I applied in-person. The process took 3 days. I interviewed at Texas Tech University (Lubbock, TX) in Feb 2014
Interview Descriptions: They ask you why you want to work here. They know most people are college students so they know you just want some money. Just give generic answers and you'll get the job. Very simple.
Interview Questions: Why do you want to work here

title: PhD Student Interview
Application Type: I applied online. The process took 2 months. I interviewed at Texas Tech University (Lubbock, TX) in Feb 2014
Interview Descriptions: over Skype, the PhD committee asked me questions about my research interests and past experiences and teaching capabilities. They asked about my Master project, and the papers I had published before.
Interview Questions: why I want to pursue my PhD

title: Student Supervisor Interview
Application Type: I interviewed at Texas Tech University
Interview Descriptions: Follow-up after applying to schedule an interview, then after one interviewing session you will either be hired or they will choose to move onto another candidate.
Interview Questions: How to troubleshoot a network connection?

title: Advisor Interview
Application Type: I applied online. The process took 2 months. I interviewed at Texas Tech University (Lubbock, TX) in Jan 2014
Interview Descriptions: Applied online, few weeks later got called in for an interview. Went for an interview and got a call next day with an offer. Accepted offer and started few weeks later
Interview Questions: Easy ,no difficult questions. Talked about future responsibilities  and functions of the department. Interviewed with a panel

title: Student Assistant Interview
Application Type: I applied through other source. The process took 1 day. I interviewed at Texas Tech University (Lubbock, TX) in Jan 2014
Interview Descriptions: Very short process. Asked questions about schedule and availability. Walked around was introduced to staff. They were very friendly.  Was asked to start that same day.  Then the coordinator offered position.
Interview Questions: What does your schedule look like for next semester?

title: Graduate Assistant Interview
Application Type: I applied through college or university. The process took 1 day. I interviewed at Texas Tech University (Lubbock, TX) in Dec 2013
Interview Descriptions: The interview process was very simple just one round face to face with three member of the IT team, not much of the technical questions. One guy was focusing on technical skills and other the director and associate director were keep asking about general skills
Interview Questions: 1.How to fix computer log error?

title: Student Assistant Interview
Application Type: I applied through an employee referral. The process took 1 day. I interviewed at Texas Tech University (Lubbock, TX) in Dec 2013
Interview Descriptions: Very quick. If they like you and want to hire you, expect a call back the same day as your interview. This of course varies by department but seems to be somewhat consistent university wide. Straight forward interviews. No behavioral questions.
Interview Questions: Where are you from?

title: Postdoctoral Interview
Application Type: I interviewed at Texas Tech University
Interview Descriptions: Received an email to schedule a phone interview to check for availability and interest for the position. Interview varies with the professor. The interview lasted between 30 mins and 1 hour, being purely technical with no behavioural questions. Based on previous experiences and skills acquired at previous positions. Most of the questions were based on experience with specific techniques and knowledge to instrumentation required for the postdoctoral position. Last questions were focused on career interest and future availability for the position.
Interview Questions: How do you handle a difficult situation in a work environment?

title: Teaching Assistant Interview
Application Type: I applied online. The process took 1 week. I interviewed at Texas Tech University (Lubbock, TX) in Aug 2013
Interview Descriptions: The interviewer asked Basic questions, interview was easy to crack, Evaluation of credentials. Try to evaluate your work ethic, professionalism, knowledge about subject material. It is important to be on time
Interview Questions: GPA

title: Student Assistant Interview
Application Type: I applied online. The process took 1 day. I interviewed at Texas Tech University (Lubbock, TX) in Aug 2013
Interview Descriptions: You submit a Tech job form indicating your demographic information and hours you're willing to work and you also submit a resume listing your job experience through RaiderJobs. You are interviewed over the phone or in person.
Interview Questions: Describe a time you were in a difficult situation and how you resolved the situation. Expect questions where you worked in a team.

title: Assistant Professor Interview
Application Type: I applied online. The process took 1+ week. I interviewed at Texas Tech University (Lubbock, TX) in Jun 2013
Interview Descriptions: The interview process started on a phone call to investigate my interest for the position. Then I was invited for a campus interview. The campus interview last a day long. It started with a breakfast with two faculties. Then, I met with the department head. After, I had a presentation to faculty members. The lunch included informal interview to discuss opportunities for collaboration. The last interview (talk) was with the dean. The next day, I had a phone call from the dean for the offer.
Interview Questions: One of the most important investigation was about the opportunity for bringing grants to the university.

title: Research Assistant Interview
Application Type: I applied online. The process took 1 day. I interviewed at Texas Tech University (Lubbock, TX) in May 2013
Interview Descriptions: It was one to one interview. I has applied online and actually moved to lubbock before interview. I was accepted for graduate school but did not have a research assistant position yet. The professor invited me to his office and I had simple interview with him. He/ She asked about my research experience and course work.
Interview Questions: What is your strength?

title: Assistant Professor Interview
Application Type: I applied in-person. I interviewed at Texas Tech University
Interview Descriptions: Nicely welcomed and provided all I needed
Interview Questions: How you will adjust to a small city like Lubbock

title: Assistant Director Interview
Application Type: I applied online. The process took 2 weeks. I interviewed at Texas Tech University
Interview Descriptions: 1 interview with hiring manager, job offer after approximately one week.
Interview Questions: Where do you see yourself in five years?

title: Student Assistant Interview
Application Type: I applied online. The process took 1 week. I interviewed at Texas Tech University (Lubbock, TX) in Jan 2013
Interview Descriptions: applied online. got a call in week and everything went well
Interview Questions: N/A

title: Student Assistant Interview
Application Type: I applied through college or university. The process took 5 days. I interviewed at Texas Tech University (Lubbock, TX) in Jan 2013
Interview Descriptions: laid back, casual, business professional attire, I went and basically talked about interests and what I was looking for in the job. I was nervous at first but felt comfortable shortly after getting there.
Interview Questions: tell me about yourself

title: Student Assistant Interview
Application Type: I applied in-person. The process took 2 weeks. I interviewed at Texas Tech University (Lubbock, TX) in Oct 2012
Interview Descriptions: Emailed the professor. Received a reply after more than a week. Met with him at his office for a brief informal interview. He then proceeded to ask me a few personalities questions plus a few questions on the subject the position is for.
