Interview Questions: What grade do I get on the subject I want to tutor in?

title: Research Assistant Interview
Application Type: I applied through an employee referral. I interviewed at Texas Tech University (Lubbock, TX) in Sept 2012
Interview Descriptions: Discussed about resume. Work experience helps.
Interview Questions: N/A

title: Student Assistant Interview
Application Type: I applied online. I interviewed at Texas Tech University (Lubbock, TX) in Aug 2012
Interview Descriptions: I have applied for job student assistant in hospitality services. Had one on one interview. He asked what experience I had, how will I manage if some customer gets angry, how you treat your customers. Do you want to work for just one semester or entire year.
Interview Questions: what is your experience in this?

title: Graduate Teaching Assistant Interview
Application Type: I applied online. The process took 5 days. I interviewed at Texas Tech University (Lubbock, TX) in Jul 2012
Interview Descriptions: Admitted doctoral graduate students are guaranteed one year of teaching stipend. They ask you a little about your goals but it is mostly passing an english language test and you can teach a few different levels.
Interview Questions: What are your career goals?

title: Programmer Analyst Interview
Application Type: I applied online. The process took 4 weeks. I interviewed at Texas Tech University (Lubbock, TX) in Jul 2012
Interview Descriptions: Online application. One technical and behavioral interview with manager and lead. One last casual interview. The interviews are thorough. You would have to be great in whatever you do. The interviewer try to comfort you before starting the interview. You will feel nice throughout the interview. In my case there were four interviewers. The interviewers were really nice and they asked questions in their area of expertise. The other informal interview was to just a behavioral interview which you don't have to worry about.
Interview Questions: Deep Technical Knowledge.

title: Student Assistant Interview
Application Type: I applied through college or university. The process took 5 weeks. I interviewed at Texas Tech University (Lubbock, TX) in Jun 2012
Interview Descriptions: Submitted resume and cover letter to boss, and got a phone call on an interview process. Simple interview in a very professional manner, with easy to answer questions, after the interview, it was two-three weeks before I heard anything. After that, I was asked for several references to call from previous employers. After the reference check, I sent examples of my previous work as a writer. Then two weeks later I got a phone call that I had received the position.
Interview Questions: Name a time in previous employment that you dealt with and overcame a difficult situation.

title: Student Assistant Interview
Application Type: I interviewed at Texas Tech University (Lubbock, TX) in May 2012
Interview Descriptions: It is a one on one interview followed by a tour around the office.
Interview Questions: Various questions on microsoft office - excel, access. Nothing difficult though.

title: Research Associate Interview
Application Type: I applied online. The process took 1 day. I interviewed at Texas Tech University (Dallas, TX) in Mar 2012
Interview Descriptions: please be aware that this is not very formal interview.  They checked my background according to my CV, and asked me why I applied for the post. I am not very well prepared on it. But it is ok, not a big deal. I still hold my current job. Next time I will be more prepared. Anyway, who knows?
Interview Questions: why did you apply for the job?

title: Student Assistant Interview
Application Type: I applied online. I interviewed at Texas Tech University (Lubbock, TX) in Mar 2012
Interview Descriptions: Applied online,got a phone call from the manager the next day to come over for the interview.There were two guys taking my interview both were very nice and asked easy and related questions.One was the section supervisor and one was programmer anlyst.The interview went well and they just asked basic questions from the resume and told me on the spot to join in next day.
Interview Questions: Basic questions from resume

title: Student Assistant Interview
Application Type: I applied through an employee referral. The process took 2 days. I interviewed at Texas Tech University (Lubbock, TX) in Feb 2012
Interview Descriptions: My Friend recommended to apply for a job, I applied and got interview call from Hiring Manager. Phone interview went well and the next day he called me for onsite interview in library, it was mostly behavioral and time management questions, did ask me some history questions. I was international student, I wasn't able to answer them. Hiring manager encouraged fellow student assistants to learn history and involved us in learning history for the time we were working there.
Interview Questions: How you balance work and study ?

title: IT Technician Interview
Application Type: I applied through college or university. The process took 2 months. I interviewed at Texas Tech University (Lubbock, TX) in Jan 2012
Interview Descriptions: I filled out a brief employment form and a 3 page questionnaire about basic IT Task. I met with the current Director and IT Coordinator and talked about my experience and why I thought they should hire me.
Interview Questions: What is active directory?

title: Student Assistant Interview
Application Type: I applied online. I interviewed at Texas Tech University (Lubbock, TX) in Jan 2012
Interview Descriptions: The interview was very professional.  They responded to my application very quickly and we were able to set a interview date fairly easy. The Director of the office and one of the Coordinators sat down with just me.   They asked very engaging questions about relative and fair questions regarding my previous job experience and what I expect out of the job being offered.
Interview Questions: How would you respond to a student who wanted to study in a foreign country that is very dangerous at the moment.

title: Director Interview
Application Type: I applied online. The process took 4 weeks. I interviewed at Texas Tech University (Lubbock, TX) in Jan 2012
Interview Descriptions: It began with an on-line application (application, resume, references, statement of purpose).  Interviews consisted of individual interviews with relevant administration in the Dean's office, as well as a panel interview with about 6-8 different faculty and program directors.
Interview Questions: I don't recall any questions being overly difficult or unexpected.  I had been in the position of Assistant Director of the same department for 5 years prior to applying to the position of Director.  I had a detailed plan of what I intended to do if given the offer.

title: Director Interview
Application Type: The process took 4 weeks. I interviewed at Texas Tech University (Lubbock, TX) in Dec 2011
Interview Descriptions: apply, interview, hire
Interview Questions: What are your weaknesses

title: Accountant Interview
Application Type: I applied online. The process took 1 day. I interviewed at Texas Tech University (Lubbock, TX) in Sept 2011
Interview Descriptions: Basic questions on previous work experience. Questions on knowledge of quick books. Inquiries about my ability to problem solve, work with others, knowledge of basic financial principles. Tour of facilities. Met individuals I would likely work with. Review of benefit and some company policies. Was not asked to provide references. Generally a ok experience. Would apply for other jobs at the university.
Interview Questions: Why do you want to work here?

title: Teaching Assistant Interview
Application Type: I applied through college or university. The process took 2 weeks. I interviewed at Texas Tech University (Lubbock, TX) in Aug 2011
Interview Descriptions: Interview process was vague and unfair
Interview Questions: none

title: Community Manager/Content Manager Interview
Application Type: I applied online. I interviewed at Texas Tech University in May 2011
Interview Descriptions: Applying online for this position (and others) was easy with the TTU careers website. The interview was conducted via phone and an offer extended within a week, with another week to consider it. Since I was moving from 500 miles away, that was very helpful as I discussed the move with family and considered moving expenses, etc.
Interview Questions: The interview was very straightforward for the most part. The only odd questions for a technical position regarded interpersonal/management skill set.

title: Student Assistant Interview
Application Type: I applied online. The process took 1 week. I interviewed at Texas Tech University (Lubbock, TX) in May 2011
Interview Descriptions:
This interview was with the LTMS librarian about a student assistant position which required programming experience. The interview was based on the future technical problem which needed to be solved. 
You don't need to prepare for the interview just need to convince the interviewer that you have the skills and can do the job.
Interview Questions: Create XML's from rows of an excel sheet

title: Graduate Research Assistant Interview
Application Type: I applied online. The process took 4 weeks. I interviewed at Texas Tech University (Lubbock, TX) in Feb 2011
Interview Descriptions: Phone interview about the previous research, course work I did as an undergraduate, previous teaching experience and future research plans. Then they send me the offer letter and I accepted it
Interview Questions: What is my undergrad GPA?

title: Student Manager Interview
Application Type: I applied through college or university. The process took 2 days. I interviewed at Texas Tech University (Lubbock, TX) in Jan 2011
Interview Descriptions: Fairly easy interview, especially if you are a student. They just ask you some personality questions that anyone can answer correctly. It is more based off experience and leadership than anything else.  Hospitality services serves many different purposes on the Texas Tech campus, so my interview may vary greatly from someone else's.
Interview Questions: What are some personality traits you look for in a leader?

title: Student Assistant Interview
Application Type: I applied in-person. The process took 1 day. I interviewed at Texas Tech University (Lubbock, TX) in Jan 2011
Interview Descriptions: Basic questions about overall information about food and regulations is brought up if working for their food department. A run through food management. Overall expectations and job review was provided on the spot and also asked when you could start. They asked which area you would like to work in as well. If Quiznos is still there DO NOT WORK THERE.
Interview Questions: What does your schedule look like?

title: Research Assistant Interview
Application Type: The process took 3 days. I interviewed at Texas Tech University (Lubbock, TX) in Dec 2010
Interview Descriptions: This was in regards to a research assistant position in the department of engineering. Mainly consisted of research based questions
Interview Questions: Why do you think I should hire you

title: Graduate Research Assistant Interview
Application Type: I applied through college or university. The process took 1 week. I interviewed at Texas Tech University (Lubbock, TX) in Jan 2010
Interview Descriptions: Total two interviews: First interview with the PI/professor and second interview with the head of research lab. Interview questions were based on prior experience in using high vacuum equipment, and theoretical knowledge on semiconductor physics. Total interview time was 30 minutes.
Interview Questions: How do I follow (or) deal with chemical safety in the lab in case of an accident, and my attitude to lab safety in general!

title: Co-op Vermont Interview
Application Type: I applied online. The process took 1 day. I interviewed at Texas Tech University (Lubbock, TX) in Jan 2010
Interview Descriptions: I got a phone interview about a week ago and I think it went ok, pretty simple but at the same time I had to do my research IBM because i got an emial on monday and the interview took place the next day. Yesterday I got an email inviting me for a second phone interview for this coop in vermont. I have completed the IPATO an everything, but i dont really know what to expect... any ideas..
Interview Questions: What kind of outdoors activity do you practice?

title: Graduate Assistant Interview
Application Type: The process took 1+ week. I interviewed at Texas Tech University (Lubbock, TX) in Aug 2008
Interview Descriptions: The interview consisted of few general questions and compatibility questions regarding the position.
Interview Questions: What do you think is necessary for a Graduate Assistant Position

title: Teaching Assistant Interview
Application Type: I applied through college or university. The process took 1 day. I interviewed at Texas Tech University in Aug 2007
Interview Descriptions:
Teaching Assistant interview:
Openings were advertised on notice boards, and you were asked to apply in the department office. Generally office staff are very friendly and helpful and registering for the interviews was very easy.

1 : 1 Interview:
Since it was for a teaching assistantship in an engineering department, the questions were asked on several undergraduate courses being offered by the department
Interview Questions: None of the questions were unexpected, several questions were asked to test knowledge and understanding of fundamentals
